nicolebutterfield: Jen! THANK YOU for sharing this. This is raw and this is real. I am also a business owner (just starting out!) and have had a lot of hard things happen this past year and continue to happen now. It's hard to be the face of your company that promotes positivity, happiness and everything great when you feel like absolute garbage sometimes. What you wrote about everything hurting, that's real, I've felt that too. I've been there feeling like I am numb and paralyzed and everything around me is moving in a circular heavy motion and I can't do anything about it. Hours feel like minutes. Tears flow without any control. No matter how hard you try every thought that goes through your head is a bad one - but it's almost like that's what you want, that's the only thing that makes it better, like covering it up with positivity and happy bullshit doesn't solve the issue, the negative thoughts seem to be helping. I'm not a chronically depressed person, and I don't think you are either, life just really sucks sometimes and it's ok to admit that. But! I really do believe it will get better. madmommaevents: Time to start a ritual that makes you happy. Hot tea. A good magazine. A walk around the block. And then some snap chat. We are all in a funk here because we are living in a rental that doesn't feel like home and have been displaced peeps since June. We will have a home end of March, but aligning this difficult time with that of a Midwest winter was not the best idea for our mental health. Stomach flu, colds, pregnancy yucks, it all is kind of folding in. We haven't had sun here in weeks. Trump. But rituals help me. Stopping by the cafe to take home fresh hummus for a midnight snack later helps me. Playing angry birds pop ball on my phone helps me. Putting lotion on my dry ass body before bed helps me. Mirrors don't help me. So I don't look in one. Which is why my friends have to blend my makeup for me when they see me in public because I'm still using my summer foundation which is four shades too tan. You've got this.

schnellbruton: There was about a 2 year period where shit got dark 🌧🕳 and I did EVERYTHING (therapy, meds, acupuncture, herbs, so. much. exercise) and it just wouldn't lift. Eventually I got to this point of like, what else is there to make me feel better and I ran out of options. So I just got fed up and was like, I can't feel like this one more day. And then slowly the fog just lifted again. It's been 4 years since that lowest point and life just gets better and better. A slight fog will always come & go but I LIVE my life so much more now that I know what's it's like to lose years feeling like shit. Jen, you're fucking rainbow is coming soon. Hold on, brace for impact & let the light in when you just can't take one more day of the dark fog which will literally keep you in bed for days on end. ❤️💛💚💙💜
